words.definition: a two-wheeled vehicle that you sit on and move by turning the two pedals
words.example: I ride my _______ to work.

words.definition: to have the same opinion
words.example: I ______ with you on this issue.

words.definition: feeling fear, or feeling worry about the possible results of a particular situation
words.example: I am _____ of spiders.

words.definition: extremely good
words.example: The food is ______, thank you.

words.definition: to respect and approve of someone or their behaviour
words.example: I _____ athletes for their commitment to sports.

words.definition: to speak angrily to someone, telling that person that you disagree with them
words.example: We always _____ about which car is better.

words.definition: an opinion that someone offers you about what you should do or how you should act in a particular situation
words.example: He gave me some good ____ about the situation.

words.definition: unpleasantly proud and behaving as if you are more important than, or know more than, other people
words.example: They are being extremely ______ and rude.

words.definition: showing no fear of dangerous or difficult things
words.example: It was a ____ decision to quit her job and start her own business.

words.definition: very attractive
words.example: The scenery around here is _____.

words.definition: A person, animal, thing or activity that could harm you
words.example: The trip was too ______ so they stayed at home.

words.definition: making very little noise
words.example: It's so _____ without the kids here.

words.definition: able to learn and understand things easily
words.example: She is a very ______ person with some great ideas.

words.definition: to smile while making sounds with your voice that show you think something is funny or you are happy
words.example: She's so funny - she really makes me ______.

words.definition: easy to see, recognize, or understand
words.example: It's _____ that he's upset.

words.definition: complete and correct in every way, of the best possible type or without fault
words.example: The car is in ______ condition.

words.definition: to know the meaning of something that someone says
words.example: She explained the whole idea, but I still don't _______.

words.definition: not polite; offensive or embarrassing
words.example: It's _____ not to say 'thank you'.

words.definition: to pronounce words or sounds, to express a thought, opinion, or suggestion, or to state a fact or instruction
words.example: Small children find it difficult to ____ long words.

words.definition: powerful; having or using great force or control
words.example: She must be very ____ to carry all that weight.

words.definition: to move along by putting one foot in front of the other, allowing each foot to touch the ground before lifting the next
words.example: I ____ to work every morning.

words.definition: in need of rest or sleep
words.example: I was so _____ when I got home from work last night.

words.definition: different from others of the same type in a way that is surprising, interesting, or attractive
words.example: I like the dress because it is very _____.
